abstract: We prove the Collatz Conjecture conditionally on the Conformal Mixing Lemma and provide comprehensive empirical validation. Theoretical framework: the integer manifold (‚Ñ§‚Çä, V=ln n) is a dissipative system where the Collatz map performs gradient descent. The '3n+1' operation creates arithmetic friction via binary carry propagation, forcing trajectories to sample the intrinsic 2-adic density œÅ(k)=2^(-k), yielding expected operational strain ‚ü®‚àáS‚ü© = ln(3/4) ‚âà -0.288 < 0 per cycle. Empirical validation (n ‚â§ 1000): (1) gradient ‚àáV = -1 in 99.85% of steps, (2) 2.03:1 dissipative-to-forcing ratio confirming E[k]=2, (3) perfect laminar channels at powers of 2, (4) turbulence-stopping time correlation 0.9994. Results establish Collatz as deterministic gradient descent, not stochastic process.
